intro: Ruschia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features upright, branched stems covered in dense, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red, depending on the variety. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Ruschia stricta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
